moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 g6 3. d4 Bg7 4. dxc5: the sharpest continuation for White: testing Blacks' bluff...
moves.4... Qa5+ 5. c3: I am still not sure, what is the best continuation for White...
moves.5... Qxc5 6. Be2 e6: following my usual scheme, for the Sicilian...
moves.7. O-O Ne7 8. Be3: of course: the Black Queen has to be contested, at some point...
moves.8... Qc7 9. Bd4 O-O: all is well, on the Western Frontier...
moves.10. h4: White has to come up with something: this would not have been my choice...
moves.10... Nbc6 11. Be3 d5: the signature Sicilian move: open up the d-file...
moves.12. Nbd2: White is losing tempo swiftly now...
moves.14... b6 15. Ba3 Be6: Black has completed development: all lines are secured...
moves.17. Ng5 h6: Black is not impressed: Nxf7 is in Blacks' favor...
moves.18. Nf3: a very weak move: probably the losing one...
moves.20. Nbd4: there it is: the losing move...
moves.20... Nxd4 21. Nxd4 Bxd4: Black resigns: after cxd4, Qxc2 loses the Queen...
